dn14:1.1.3.pli: Atha kho sambahulānaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ pacchābhattaṁ piṇḍapātapaṭikkantānaṁ karerimaṇḍalamāḷe sannisinnānaṁ sannipatitānaṁ pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttā dhammī kathā udapādi:
dn14:1.1.3.en: Then after the meal, on return from alms-round, several senior mendicants sat together in the pavilion by the kari tree and this Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives came up among them,

dn14:1.3.1.pli: “Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
dn14:1.3.1.en: “Would you like to hear a Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives?”

dn14:1.3.3.pli: yaṁ bhagavā pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
dn14:1.3.3.en: Let the Buddha give a Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

dn14:1.15.5.pli: Iccheyyātha no tumhe, bhikkhave, bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti?
dn14:1.15.5.en: Would you like to hear a further Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives?”

dn14:1.15.7.pli: yaṁ bhagavā bhiyyoso mattāya pubbenivāsapaṭisaṁyuttaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyya, bhagavato sutvā bhikkhū dhāressantī”ti.
dn14:1.15.7.en: Let the Buddha give a further Dhamma talk on the subject of past lives. The mendicants will listen and remember it.”

dn14:3.1.8.pli: Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā’ti.
dn14:3.1.8.en: And if I were to teach the Dhamma, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.’

dn14:3.2.10.pli: Itiha, bhikkhave, vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no dhammadesanāya.
dn14:3.2.10.en: So, as the Buddha Vipassī reflected like this, his mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.

dn14:3.2.12.pli: ‘nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma vipassissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no dhammadesanāyā’ti.
dn14:3.2.12.en: ‘Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.’

dn14:3.3.2.pli: ‘desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ,
dn14:3.3.2.en: ‘Sir, let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma! Let the Holy One teach the Dhamma!

dn14:3.4.9.pli: Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā”ti.
dn14:3.4.9.en: “If I were to teach the Dhamma, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.”

dn14:3.4.19.pli: Itiha me, brahme, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ nami, no dhammadesanāyā’ti.
dn14:3.4.19.en: So, as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.’

dn14:3.7.10.en: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!

dn14:3.7.16.en: the sophisticated, sublime Dhamma among humans.’

dn14:3.7.17.pli: Atha kho so, bhikkhave, mahābrahmā: ‘katāvakāso khomhi vipassinā bhagavatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena dhammadesanāyā’ti vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tattheva antaradhāyi.
dn14:3.7.17.en: Then the Great Brahmā, knowing that his request for the Buddha Vipassī to teach the Dhamma had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled him, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

dn14:3.11.6.pli: evameva khaṇḍassa ca rājaputtassa tissassa ca purohitaputtassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
dn14:3.11.6.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in the king’s son Khaṇḍa and the high priest’s son Tissa:

dn14:3.12.1.pli: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
dn14:3.12.1.en: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipassī,

dn14:3.13.2.pli: Te vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi;
dn14:3.13.2.en: Then the Buddha Vipassī educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

dn14:3.15.6.pli: evameva tesaṁ caturāsītipāṇasahassānaṁ tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
dn14:3.15.6.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in those 84,000 people:

dn14:3.16.1.pli: Te diṭṭhadhammā pattadhammā viditadhammā pariyogāḷhadhammā tiṇṇavicikicchā vigatakathaṅkathā vesārajjappattā aparappaccayā satthusāsane vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ etadavocuṁ:
dn14:3.16.1.en: They saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. They went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. They said to the Buddha Vipassī,

dn14:3.18.2.pli: ‘vipassī kira bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho bandhumatiṁ rājadhāniṁ anuppatto kheme migadāye viharati, dhammañca kira desetī’ti.
dn14:3.18.2.en: ‘It seems the Blessed One Vipassī, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, has arrived at Bandhumatī and is staying in the deer park named Sanctuary. And he is teaching the Dhamma!’

dn14:3.18.3.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, tāni caturāsītipabbajitasahassāni yena bandhumatī rājadhānī yena khemo migadāyo yena vipassī bhagavā arahaṁ sammāsambuddho tenupasaṅkamiṁsu; upasaṅkamitvā vipassiṁ bhagavantaṁ arahantaṁ sammāsambuddhaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdiṁsu.
dn14:3.18.3.en: Then they too went to see the Buddha Vipassī, realized the Dhamma, went forth, and became freed from defilements.

dn14:3.22.6.pli: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
dn14:3.22.6.en: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

dn14:3.26.3.pli: desetha, bhikkhave, dhammaṁ ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetha.
dn14:3.26.3.en: Teach the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

dn14:3.29.18.pli: Vipassissa, mārisā, bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
dn14:3.29.18.en: And such was his renunciation, such his going forth, such his striving, such his awakening, and such his rolling forth of the wheel of Dhamma.

dn14:3.30.13.pli: Bhagavato, mārisā, evaṁ abhinikkhamanaṁ ahosi evaṁ pabbajjā evaṁ padhānaṁ evaṁ abhisambodhi evaṁ dhammacakkappavattanaṁ.
dn14:3.30.13.en: And such was your renunciation, such your going forth, such your striving, such your awakening, and such your rolling forth of the wheel of Dhamma.

dn16:1.12.1.pli: Tatra sudaṁ bhagavā rājagahe viharanto gijjhakūṭe pabbate etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:1.12.1.en: And while staying there at the Vulture’s Peak the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.14.2.pli: Tatrāpi sudaṁ bhagavā ambalaṭṭhikāyaṁ viharanto rājāgārake etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:1.14.2.en: And while staying there, too, he often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.18.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nāḷandāyaṁ viharanto pāvārikambavane etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:1.18.1.en: And while staying at Nāḷandā, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:1.25.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pāṭaligāmike upāsake bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uyyojesi:
dn16:1.25.1.en: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the lay followers of Pāṭaligāma with a Dhamma talk. Then he dismissed them,

dn16:2.4.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā koṭigāme viharanto etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:2.4.1.en: And while staying at Koṭigāma, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.8.3.pli: Tasmātihānanda, dhammādāsaṁ nāma dhammapariyāyaṁ desessāmi, yena samannāgato ariyasāvako ākaṅkhamāno attanāva attānaṁ byākareyya:
dn16:2.8.3.en: So Ānanda, I will teach you the explanation of the Dhamma called ‘the mirror of the teaching’. A noble disciple who has this may declare of themselves:

dn16:2.10.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā nātike viharanto giñjakāvasathe etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:2.10.1.en: And while staying there in Nādika the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.14.4.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho ambapāliṁ gaṇikaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:2.14.4.en: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a Dhamma talk.

dn16:2.18.2.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho te licchavī bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:2.18.2.en: and the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

dn16:2.19.9.pli: Atha kho bhagavā ambapāliṁ gaṇikaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
dn16:2.19.9.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired her with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

dn16:2.20.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā vesāliyaṁ viharanto ambapālivane etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:2.20.1.en: And while staying at Vesālī, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:2.25.2.pli: Desito, ānanda, mayā dhammo anantaraṁ abāhiraṁ karitvā.
dn16:2.25.2.en: I’ve taught the Dhamma without making any distinction between secret and public teachings.

dn16:3.18.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, ānanda, yadā tathāgato anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavatteti, tadāyaṁ pathavī kampati saṅkampati sampakampati sampavedhati.
dn16:3.18.1.en: Furthermore, when the Realized One rolls forth the supreme Wheel of Dhamma, the earth shakes and rocks and trembles.

dn16:3.22.4.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
dn16:3.22.4.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

dn16:3.22.7.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
dn16:3.22.7.en: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

dn16:3.23.11.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
dn16:3.23.11.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

dn16:3.23.14.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
dn16:3.23.14.en: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

dn16:4.4.1.pli: Tatrāpi sudaṁ bhagavā bhaṇḍagāme viharanto etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:4.4.1.en: And while staying there, too, he often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:4.12.1.pli: Tatrapi sudaṁ bhagavā bhoganagare viharanto ānande cetiye etadeva bahulaṁ bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ karoti:
dn16:4.12.1.en: And while staying at the Ānanda shrine, too, the Buddha often gave this Dhamma talk to the mendicants:

dn16:4.14.3.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:4.14.3.en: The Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dhamma talk.

dn16:4.19.5.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho cundaṁ kammāraputtaṁ bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
dn16:4.19.5.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired him with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

dn16:4.36.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pukkusaṁ mallaputtaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
dn16:4.36.1.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired Pukkusa the Malla with a Dhamma talk,

dn16:5.8.5.pli: ‘Idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’ti, ānanda, saddhassa kulaputtassa dassanīyaṁ saṁvejanīyaṁ ṭhānaṁ.
dn16:5.8.5.en: Thinking: ‘Here the supreme Wheel of Dhamma was rolled forth by the Realized One!’—that is an inspiring place.

dn16:5.8.9.pli: ‘idha tathāgato jāto’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anuttaraṁ sammāsambodhiṁ abhisambuddho’tipi, ‘idha tathāgatena anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitan’tipi, ‘idha tathāgato anupādisesāya nibbānadhātuyā parinibbuto’tipi.
dn16:5.8.9.en: ‘Here the Realized One was born!’ and ‘Here the Realized One became awakened as a supreme fully awakened Buddha!’ and ‘Here the supreme Wheel of Dhamma was rolled forth by the Realized One!’ and ‘Here the Realized One became fully extinguished through the natural principle of extinguishment, without anything left over!’

dn16:5.26.7.en: I shall teach you the Dhamma.

dn16:6.11.14.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ca anuruddho āyasmā ca ānando taṁ rattāvasesaṁ dhammiyā kathāya vītināmesuṁ.
dn16:6.11.14.en: Ānanda and Anuruddha spent the rest of the night talking about Dhamma.

mn139:3.4.pli: ussādanañca ñatvā apasādanañca ñatvā nevussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammameva deseyya.
mn139:3.4.en: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach Dhamma.

mn139:6.2.pli: ussādanañca ñatvā apasādanañca ñatvā nevussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammameva deseyyā’ti—
mn139:6.2.en: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach Dhamma.’

mn139:7.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, ussādanā ca hoti apasādanā ca, no ca dhammadesanā?
mn139:7.1.en: And how is there flattering and rebuking without teaching Dhamma?

mn139:7.14.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, ussādanā ca hoti apasādanā ca, no ca dhammadesanā.
mn139:7.14.en: That’s how there is flattering and rebuking without teaching Dhamma.

mn139:8.1.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, nevussādanā hoti na apasādanā, dhammadesanā ca?
mn139:8.1.en: And how is there neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching Dhamma?

mn139:8.3.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:

mn139:8.8.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:

mn139:8.13.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:

mn139:8.18.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:

mn139:8.23.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:

mn139:8.27.en: Rather, by saying this you just teach Dhamma:

mn139:8.30.pli: Evaṁ kho, bhikkhave, nevussādanā hoti na apasādanā, dhammadesanā ca.
mn139:8.30.en: That’s how there is neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching Dhamma.

mn139:8.32.pli: ussādanañca ñatvā apasādanañca ñatvā nevussādeyya, na apasādeyya, dhammameva deseyyā’ti—
mn139:8.32.en: Knowing these, avoid them, and just teach Dhamma.’

mn139:13.16.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṁ ussādanā ca apasādanā ca no ca dhammadesanā, sadukkho eso dhammo saupaghāto saupāyāso sapariḷāho;
mn139:13.16.en: Flattering and rebuking without teaching Dhamma is a principle beset by pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the wrong way.

mn139:13.19.pli: Tatra, bhikkhave, yāyaṁ nevussādanā ca na apasādanā ca dhammadesanā ca, adukkho eso dhammo anupaghāto anupāyāso apariḷāho;
mn139:13.19.en: Neither flattering nor rebuking, and just teaching Dhamma is a principle free of pain, harm, stress, and fever, and it is the right way.

an3.61:9.1.pli: Ayaṁ kho pana, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.1.en: But the Dhamma that I’ve taught is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.

an3.61:9.2.pli: Katamo ca, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi?
an3.61:9.2.en: What is the Dhamma that I’ve taught?

an3.61:9.3.pli: Imā cha dhātuyoti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.3.en: ‘These are the six elements’: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …

an3.61:9.4.pli: Imāni cha phassāyatanānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.4.en: ‘These are the six fields of contact’: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …

an3.61:9.5.pli: Ime aṭṭhārasa manopavicārāti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.5.en: ‘These are the eighteen mental preoccupations’: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …

an3.61:9.6.pli: Imāni cattāri ariyasaccānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhi.
an3.61:9.6.en: ‘These are the four noble truths’: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught that is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and is not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.

an3.61:10.1.pli: Imā cha dhātuyoti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:10.1.en: ‘“These are the six elements”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:10.6.pli: Imā cha dhātuyoti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:10.6.en: ‘“These are the six elements”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:11.1.pli: Imāni cha phassāyatanānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:11.1.en: ‘“These are the six fields of contact”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:11.6.pli: Imāni cha phassāyatanānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:11.6.en: ‘“These are the six fields of contact”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:12.1.pli: Ime aṭṭhārasa manopavicārāti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:12.1.en: ‘“These are the eighteen mental preoccupations”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:12.10.pli: Ime aṭṭhārasa manopavicārāti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:12.10.en: ‘“These are the eighteen mental preoccupations”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:13.1.pli: Imāni cattāri ariyasaccānīti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:13.1.en: ‘“These are the four noble truths”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught …’

an3.61:17.5.pli: ‘Imāni cattāri ariyasaccānī’ti, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo desito aniggahito asaṅkiliṭṭho anupavajjo appaṭikuṭṭho samaṇehi brāhmaṇehi viññūhīti.
an3.61:17.5.en: ‘“These are the four noble truths”: this is the Dhamma I’ve taught that is irrefutable, uncorrupted, beyond reproach, and is not scorned by sensible ascetics and brahmins.’

mn26:2.3.pli: “cirassutā no, āvuso ānanda, bhagavato sammukhā dhammī kathā.
mn26:2.3.en: “Reverend, it’s been a long time since we’ve heard a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.

mn26:2.4.pli: Sādhu mayaṁ, āvuso ānanda, labheyyāma bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṁ kathaṁ savanāyā”ti.
mn26:2.4.en: It would be good if we got to hear a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.”

mn26:2.6.pli: appeva nāma labheyyātha bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṁ kathaṁ savanāyā”ti.
mn26:2.6.en: Hopefully you’ll get to hear a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.”

mn26:19.6.pli: Ahañceva kho pana dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, pare ca me na ājāneyyuṁ, so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā’ti.
mn26:19.6.en: And if I were to teach the Dhamma, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.’

mn26:19.16.pli: Itiha me, bhikkhave, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no dhammadesanāya.
mn26:19.16.en: So, as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.

mn26:20.2.pli: ‘nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no dhammadesanāyā’ti.
mn26:20.2.en: ‘Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.’

mn26:20.5.pli: ‘desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ.
mn26:20.5.en: ‘Sir, let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma! Let the Holy One teach the Dhamma!

mn26:20.22.en: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!

mn26:21.9.en: the sophisticated, sublime Dhamma among humans.’

mn26:21.10.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, brahmā sahampati ‘katāvakāso khomhi bhagavatā dhammadesanāyā’ti maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
mn26:21.10.en: Then Brahmā Sahampati, knowing that his request for me to teach the Dhamma had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right, before vanishing right there.

mn26:25.19.en: to roll forth the Wheel of Dhamma.

mn26:27.4.pli: Odahatha, bhikkhave, sotaṁ, amatamadhigataṁ, ahamanusāsāmi, ahaṁ dhammaṁ desemi.
mn26:27.4.en: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved the Deathless! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.

mn26:27.11.pli: Odahatha, bhikkhave, sotaṁ, amatamadhigataṁ, ahamanusāsāmi, ahaṁ dhammaṁ desemi.
mn26:27.11.en: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved the Deathless! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.

mn26:28.5.pli: Odahatha, bhikkhave, sotaṁ, amatamadhigataṁ, ahamanusāsāmi, ahaṁ dhammaṁ desemi.
mn26:28.5.en: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved the Deathless! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.

dn34:1.6.78.pli: idhāvuso, bhikkhuno satthā dhammaṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī.
dn34:1.6.78.en: Firstly, the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant.

dn34:1.6.79.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.79.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches it.

dn34:1.6.82.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti
dn34:1.6.82.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant. But the mendicant teaches Dhamma in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.83.pli: yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.83.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how they teach it in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.86.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti. Api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti.
dn34:1.6.86.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches Dhamma. But the mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.87.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.87.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how they recite it in detail as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.90.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti.
dn34:1.6.90.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches Dhamma … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching.

dn34:1.6.92.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.92.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how they think about and consider it in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.

dn34:1.6.95.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati;
dn34:1.6.95.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches Dhamma … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching … or think about it.

dn34:1.6.97.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno aññataraṁ samādhinimittaṁ suggahitaṁ hoti sumanasikataṁ sūpadhāritaṁ suppaṭividdhaṁ paññāya tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammappaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn34:1.6.97.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

dn34:2.1.123.pli: Idhāvuso, tathāgato ca loke uppanno hoti arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito.
dn34:2.1.123.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world. He teaches the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

dn34:2.1.146.pli: ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitānamatthamaññātuṁ.
dn34:2.1.146.en: But he doesn’t teach the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as announced by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an4.139:1.1.en: “Mendicants, there are these four Dhamma speakers.

an4.139:1.3.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, ekacco dhammakathiko appañca bhāsati asahitañca;
an4.139:1.3.en: One Dhamma speaker speaks little and off topic.

an4.139:1.5.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
an4.139:1.5.en: Such an assembly regards such a Dhamma speaker simply as a Dhamma speaker.

an4.139:2.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco dhammakathiko appañca bhāsati sahitañca;
an4.139:2.1.en: One Dhamma speaker speaks little but stays on topic.

an4.139:2.3.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
an4.139:2.3.en: Such an assembly regards such a Dhamma speaker simply as a Dhamma speaker.

an4.139:3.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco dhammakathiko bahuñca bhāsati asahitañca;
an4.139:3.1.en: One Dhamma speaker speaks much but off topic.

an4.139:3.3.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
an4.139:3.3.en: Such an assembly regards such a Dhamma speaker simply as a Dhamma speaker.

an4.139:4.1.pli: Idha pana, bhikkhave, ekacco dhammakathiko bahuñca bhāsati sahitañca;
an4.139:4.1.en: One Dhamma speaker speaks much and stays on topic.

an4.139:4.3.pli: Evarūpo, bhikkhave, dhammakathiko evarūpāya parisāya dhammakathikotveva saṅkhaṁ gacchati.
an4.139:4.3.en: Such an assembly regards such a Dhamma speaker simply as a Dhamma speaker.

an4.139:4.4.en: These are the four Dhamma speakers.”

mn85:43.6.en: And if I were to teach the Dhamma, others might not understand me, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.’

mn85:43.16.pli: Itiha me, rājakumāra, paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati no dhammadesanāya.
mn85:43.16.en: And as I reflected like this, my mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.

mn85:44.2.pli: ‘nassati vata bho loko; vinassati vata bho loko. Yatra hi nāma tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati no dhammadesanāyā’ti.

mn85:44.5.en: ‘Sir, let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma! Let the Holy One teach the Dhamma!

mn85:44.22.en: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!

mn85:45.9.en: the sophisticated, sublime Dhamma among humans.’

mn85:45.10.pli: Atha kho, rājakumāra, brahmā sahampati ‘katāvakāso khomhi bhagavatā dhammadesanāyā’ti maṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyi.
mn85:45.10.en: Then Brahmā Sahampati, knowing that his request for me to teach the Dhamma had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled me, keeping me on his right, before vanishing right there.

mn85:49.20.en: to roll forth the Wheel of Dhamma.

mn85:51.4.en: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved the Deathless! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.

mn85:51.11.en: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved the Deathless! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.

mn85:52.5.en: Listen up, mendicants: I have achieved the Deathless! I shall instruct you, I will teach you the Dhamma.

an5.26:2.2.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno satthā dhammaṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī.
an5.26:2.2.en: Firstly, the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant.

an5.26:2.3.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, tassa bhikkhuno satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:2.3.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches it.

an5.26:3.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti.
an5.26:3.1.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant. But the mendicant teaches Dhamma in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:3.2.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:3.2.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how they teach it in detail to others as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:4.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti.
an5.26:4.1.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches Dhamma. But the mendicant recites the teaching in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:4.2.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:4.2.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how they recite it in detail as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:5.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti, aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti;
an5.26:5.1.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches Dhamma … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching.

an5.26:5.3.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhu yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:5.3.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how they think about and consider it in their heart, examining it with the mind as they learned and memorized it.

an5.26:6.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena sajjhāyaṁ karoti, nāpi yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ cetasā anuvitakketi anuvicāreti manasānupekkhati;
an5.26:6.1.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor … the mendicant teaches Dhamma … nor does the mendicant recite the teaching … or think about it.

an5.26:6.3.pli: Yathā yathā, bhikkhave, bhikkhuno aññataraṁ samādhinimittaṁ suggahitaṁ hoti sumanasikataṁ sūpadhāritaṁ suppaṭividdhaṁ paññāya tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an5.26:6.3.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

an9.4:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nandako upaṭṭhānasālāyaṁ bhikkhū dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
an9.4:1.2.en: Now at that time Venerable Nandaka was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants in the assembly hall with a Dhamma talk.

an9.4:4.3.pli: Etaṁ kho, nandaka, tumhākaṁ patirūpaṁ kulaputtānaṁ saddhāya agārasmā anagāriyaṁ pabbajitānaṁ, yaṁ tumhe dhammiyā kathāya sannisīdeyyātha.
an9.4:4.3.en: It’s appropriate for gentlemen like you, who have gone forth in faith from the lay life to homelessness, to sit together for a Dhamma talk.

an9.4:9.3.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:9.3.en: Firstly, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And they reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

an9.4:10.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti. Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ …pe…
an9.4:10.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the Dhamma …

an9.4:10.2.pli: brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthappaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammappaṭisaṁvedī ca.
an9.4:10.2.en: Whenever they do this, they feel inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma.

an9.4:11.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:11.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the Dhamma …

an9.4:11.2.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ …pe… brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme gambhīraṁ atthapadaṁ paññāya ativijjha passati.
an9.4:11.2.en: Whenever they do this, they see the meaning of a deep saying in that Dhamma with penetrating wisdom.

an9.4:12.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ …pe… brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:12.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the Dhamma …

an9.4:13.1.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhu bhikkhūnaṁ dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an9.4:13.1.en: Furthermore, a mendicant teaches the mendicants the Dhamma …

mn91:17.3.pli: aññadatthu dhammiyā kathāya taṁ parisaṁ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
mn91:17.3.en: Invariably, he educates, encourages, fires up, and inspires that assembly with a Dhamma talk.

mn91:21.1.pli: So ārāmagato parisati dhammaṁ deseti, na taṁ parisaṁ ussādeti, na taṁ parisaṁ apasādeti;
mn91:21.1.en: In the monastery when he teaches Dhamma to an assembly, he neither flatters them nor rebukes them.

mn91:21.2.pli: aññadatthu dhammiyā kathāya taṁ parisaṁ sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
mn91:21.2.en: Invariably, he educates, encourages, fires up, and inspires that assembly with a Dhamma talk.

mn91:21.6.pli: Te tena bhotā gotamena dhammiyā kathāya sandassitā samādapitā samuttejitā sampahaṁsitā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkamanti avalokayamānāyeva avijahitattā.
mn91:21.6.en: And when they’ve been inspired with a Dhamma talk by Master Gotama they get up from their seats and leave looking back at him alone, and not forgetting their lesson.

mn91:22.1.pli: Addasāma kho mayaṁ, bho, taṁ bhavantaṁ gotamaṁ gacchantaṁ, addasāma ṭhitaṁ, addasāma antaragharaṁ pavisantaṁ, addasāma antaraghare nisinnaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ, addasāma antaraghare bhuñjantaṁ, addasāma bhuttāviṁ nisinnaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ, addasāma bhuttāviṁ anumodantaṁ, addasāma ārāmaṁ gacchantaṁ, addasāma ārāmagataṁ nisinnaṁ tuṇhībhūtaṁ, addasāma ārāmagataṁ parisati dhammaṁ desentaṁ.
mn91:22.1.en: I have seen Master Gotama walking and standing; entering inhabited areas, and sitting and eating there; sitting silently after eating, and expressing appreciation; going to the monastery, sitting silently there, and teaching Dhamma to an assembly there.

mn91:24.8.pli: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
mn91:24.8.en: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

mn91:36.7.pli: evameva brahmāyussa brāhmaṇassa tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
mn91:36.7.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in the brahmin Brahmāyu:

mn91:36.9.pli: Atha kho brahmāyu brāhmaṇo diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
mn91:36.9.en: Then Brahmāyu saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. He went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. He said to the Buddha:

thag21.1:30.3.en: as he teaches the immaculate Dhamma,

thag21.1:31.1.en: They listen to the immaculate Dhamma

thag21.1:35.3.en: The seers of Dhamma stand unfaltering

thag21.1:37.1.en: When the Dhamma has been so well taught,

thag21.1:46.3.en: When we heard the Dhamma, we became confident—

thag21.1:63.2.en: restrained and pure, speak the Dhamma!

dn33:1.4.4.pli: Atha kho bhagavā pāveyyake malle bahudeva rattiṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uyyojesi:
dn33:1.4.4.en: The Buddha spent most of the night educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the Mallas with a Dhamma talk. Then he dismissed them,

dn33:1.5.3.en: Give them some Dhamma talk as you feel inspired.

dn33:2.1.128.pli: Idhāvuso, bhikkhuno satthā dhammaṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī.
dn33:2.1.128.en: Firstly, the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant.

dn33:2.1.129.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno satthā dhammaṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn33:2.1.129.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how the Teacher or a respected spiritual companion teaches it.

dn33:2.1.132.pli: Puna caparaṁ, āvuso, bhikkhuno na heva kho satthā dhammaṁ deseti aññataro vā garuṭṭhāniyo sabrahmacārī, api ca kho yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ vitthārena paresaṁ deseti …pe…
dn33:2.1.132.en: Furthermore, it may be that neither the Teacher nor a respected spiritual companion teaches Dhamma to a mendicant. But the mendicant teaches Dhamma in detail to others as they learned and memorized it. …

dn33:2.1.136.pli: Yathā yathā, āvuso, bhikkhuno aññataraṁ samādhinimittaṁ suggahitaṁ hoti sumanasikataṁ sūpadhāritaṁ suppaṭividdhaṁ paññāya tathā tathā so tasmiṁ dhamme atthapaṭisaṁvedī ca hoti dhammapaṭisaṁvedī ca.
dn33:2.1.136.en: That mendicant feels inspired by the meaning and the teaching in that Dhamma, no matter how a meditation subject as a foundation of immersion is properly grasped, attended, borne in mind, and comprehended with wisdom.

dn33:3.2.44.pli: Idhāvuso, tathāgato ca loke uppanno hoti arahaṁ sammāsambuddho, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito.
dn33:3.2.44.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world. He teaches the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

dn33:3.2.70.pli: dhammo ca na desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito. Ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo, paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitānamatthamaññātuṁ.
dn33:3.2.70.en: But he doesn’t teach the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

sn22.115:1.3.en: “Sir, they speak of a ‘Dhamma speaker’.

sn22.115:1.4.pli: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, dhammakathiko hotī”ti?
sn22.115:1.4.en: How is a Dhamma speaker defined?”

sn22.115:1.5.pli: “Rūpassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.115:1.5.en: “Mendicant, if a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

sn22.115:1.8.en: If a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment with feeling …

sn22.115:1.11.pli: viññāṇassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.115:1.11.en: consciousness, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

sn22.116:1.3.en: “Sir, they speak of a ‘Dhamma speaker’.

sn22.116:1.4.pli: kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, dhammakathiko hoti;
sn22.116:1.4.en: How is a Dhamma speaker defined?

sn22.116:1.6.pli: “Rūpassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.116:1.6.en: “Mendicant, if a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding form, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

sn22.116:1.9.en: If a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment with feeling …

sn22.116:1.12.pli: viññāṇassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn22.116:1.12.en: consciousness, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

an5.159:1.3.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā udāyī mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto dhammaṁ desento nisinno hoti.
an5.159:1.3.en: Now, at that time Venerable Udāyī was sitting teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.

an5.159:1.6.pli: “āyasmā, bhante, udāyī mahatiyā gihiparisāya parivuto dhammaṁ desetī”ti.
an5.159:1.6.en: “Sir, Venerable Udāyī is teaching Dhamma, surrounded by a large assembly of laypeople.”

an5.159:2.1.pli: “Na kho, ānanda, sukaraṁ paresaṁ dhammaṁ desetuṁ.
an5.159:2.1.en: “Ānanda, it’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.

an5.159:2.2.pli: Paresaṁ, ānanda, dhammaṁ desentena pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṁ dhammo desetabbo.
an5.159:2.2.en: You should establish five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.

an5.159:2.4.en: You should teach Dhamma to others thinking: ‘I will teach step by step.’ …

an5.159:2.9.pli: Na kho, ānanda, sukaraṁ paresaṁ dhammaṁ desetuṁ.
an5.159:2.9.en: It’s not easy to teach Dhamma to others.

an5.159:2.10.pli: Paresaṁ, ānanda, dhammaṁ desentena ime pañca dhamme ajjhattaṁ upaṭṭhāpetvā paresaṁ dhammo desetabbo”ti.
an5.159:2.10.en: You should establish these five things in yourself before teaching Dhamma to others.”

sn12.16:1.3.en: “Sir, they speak of a ‘Dhamma speaker’.

sn12.16:1.4.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, dhammakathiko hotī”ti?
sn12.16:1.4.en: How is a Dhamma speaker defined?”

sn12.16:2.1.pli: “Jarāmaraṇassa ce bhikkhu nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn12.16:2.1.en: “If a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding old age and death, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

sn12.16:3.1.en: If a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment regarding rebirth …

sn12.16:3.11.pli: avijjāya ce bhikkhu nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn12.16:3.11.en: If a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding ignorance, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

sn35.155:1.2.en: “Sir, they speak of a ‘Dhamma speaker’.

sn35.155:1.3.pli: Kittāvatā nu kho, bhante, dhammakathiko hotī”ti?
sn35.155:1.3.en: How is a Dhamma speaker defined?”

sn35.155:2.1.pli: “Cakkhussa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn35.155:2.1.en: “If a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment, dispassion, and cessation regarding the eye, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

sn35.155:2.4.pli: jivhāya ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya …pe…
sn35.155:2.4.en: If a mendicant teaches Dhamma for disillusionment with the ear … nose … tongue … body …

sn35.155:2.5.pli: manassa ce, bhikkhu, nibbidāya virāgāya nirodhāya dhammaṁ deseti, ‘dhammakathiko bhikkhū’ti alaṁvacanāya.
sn35.155:2.5.en: mind, for its fading away and cessation, they’re qualified to be called a ‘mendicant who speaks on Dhamma’.

sn42.7:2.2.pli: Tesāhaṁ dhammaṁ desemi—ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ, sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsemi.
sn42.7:2.2.en: I teach them the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn42.7:2.6.pli: Tesaṁ pāhaṁ dhammaṁ desemi—ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ, sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsemi.
sn42.7:2.6.en: I also teach them the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn42.7:2.10.pli: Tesaṁ pāhaṁ dhammaṁ desemi—ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsemi.
sn42.7:2.10.en: I also teach them the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn42.7:4.6.en: I teach them the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn42.7:4.10.en: I also teach them the Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And I reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn8.8:1.2.pli: Tena kho pana samayena bhagavā bhikkhū nibbānapaṭisaṁyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
sn8.8:1.2.en: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.

sn8.8:1.5.pli: “ayaṁ kho bhagavā bhikkhū nibbānapaṭisaṁyuttāya dhammiyā kathāya sandasseti samādapeti samuttejeti sampahaṁseti.
sn8.8:1.5.en: “The Buddha is educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.

sn8.8:3.3.en: as he teaches the immaculate Dhamma,

sn8.8:4.1.en: They listen to the immaculate Dhamma

sn8.8:9.3.en: The seers of Dhamma stand unfaltering

sn8.8:11.1.en: When the Dhamma has been so well taught,

sn6.1:4.1.pli: Itiha bhagavato paṭisañcikkhato appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no dhammadesanāya.
sn6.1:4.1.en: And as the Buddha reflected like this, his mind inclined to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.

sn6.1:5.2.pli: “nassati vata bho loko, vinassati vata bho loko, yatra hi nāma tathāgatassa arahato sammāsambuddhassa appossukkatāya cittaṁ namati, no dhammadesanāyā”ti.
sn6.1:5.2.en: “Oh my goodness! The world will be lost, the world will perish! For the mind of the Realized One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha, inclines to remaining passive, not to teaching the Dhamma.”

sn6.1:5.5.pli: “desetu, bhante, bhagavā dhammaṁ, desetu sugato dhammaṁ.
sn6.1:5.5.en: “Sir, let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma! Let the Holy One teach the Dhamma!

sn6.1:8.3.en: Let the Blessed One teach the Dhamma!

sn6.1:10.4.en: the sophisticated, sublime Dhamma among humans.”

sn6.1:11.1.pli: Atha kho brahmā sahampati “katāvakāso khomhi bhagavatā dhammadesanāyā”ti bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā tatthevantaradhāyīti.
sn6.1:11.1.en: Then Brahmā Sahampati, knowing that his request for the Buddha to teach the Dhamma had been granted, bowed and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on his right, before vanishing right there.

sn56.11:0.2.en: 2. Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma

sn56.11:0.3.en: 11. Rolling Forth the Wheel of Dhamma

sn56.11:11.1.pli: Imasmiñca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṁ bhaññamāne āyasmato koṇḍaññassa virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
sn56.11:11.1.en: And while this discourse was being spoken, the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in Venerable Koṇḍañña:

sn56.11:12.1.pli: Pavattite ca pana bhagavatā dhammacakke bhummā devā saddamanussāvesuṁ:
sn56.11:12.1.en: And when the Buddha rolled forth the Wheel of Dhamma, the earth gods raised the cry:

sn56.11:12.2.pli: “etaṁ bhagavatā bārāṇasiyaṁ isipatane migadāye anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitaṁ appaṭivattiyaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmin”ti.
sn56.11:12.2.en: “Near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana, the Buddha has rolled forth the supreme Wheel of Dhamma. And that wheel cannot be rolled back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.”

sn56.11:12.11.pli: “etaṁ bhagavatā bārāṇasiyaṁ isipatane migadāye anuttaraṁ dhammacakkaṁ pavattitaṁ appaṭivattiyaṁ samaṇena vā brāhmaṇena vā devena vā mārena vā brahmunā vā kenaci vā lokasmin”ti.
sn56.11:12.11.en: “Near Benares, in the deer park at Isipatana, the Buddha has rolled forth the supreme Wheel of Dhamma. And that wheel cannot be rolled back by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or by anyone in the world.”

an3.30:1.6.pli: Tassa bhikkhū dhammaṁ desenti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsenti.
an3.30:1.6.en: The mendicants teach them Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And they reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

an3.30:1.11.pli: Tassa bhikkhū dhammaṁ desenti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsenti.
an3.30:1.11.en: The mendicants teach them Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And they reveal a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.
