sn22.81:3.5.pli: “cirassutā kho no, āvuso ānanda, bhagavato sammukhā dhammī kathā;
sn22.81:3.5.en: “Reverend, it’s been a long time since we’ve heard a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.

sn22.81:3.6.pli: icchāma mayaṁ, āvuso ānanda, bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṁ kathaṁ sotun”ti.
sn22.81:3.6.en: We wish to hear a Dhamma talk from the Buddha.”

sn22.81:4.2.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinne kho te bhikkhū bhagavā dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
sn22.81:4.2.en: and the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

sn22.81:4.14.pli: Evaṁ vicayaso desito, bhikkhave, mayā dhammo.
sn22.81:4.14.en: That’s how I’ve taught the Dhamma analytically.

sn22.81:4.15.pli: Evaṁ vicayaso desite kho, bhikkhave, mayā dhamme atha ca panidhekaccassa bhikkhuno evaṁ cetaso parivitakko udapādi:
sn22.81:4.15.en: Though I’ve taught the Dhamma analytically, still a certain mendicant present here has this thought:

mn125:3.1.pli: “Sādhu me bhavaṁ aggivessano yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ desetū”ti.
mn125:3.1.en: “Master Aggivessana, please teach me the Dhamma as you have learned and memorized it.”

mn125:3.3.pli: Ahañca hi te, rājakumāra, yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, tvañca me bhāsitassa atthaṁ na ājāneyyāsi; so mamassa kilamatho, sā mamassa vihesā”ti.
mn125:3.3.en: For if I were to teach you the Dhamma as I have learned and memorized it, you might not understand the meaning, which would be wearying and troublesome for me.”

mn125:4.1.pli: “Desetu me bhavaṁ aggivessano yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ.
mn125:4.1.en: “Master Aggivessana, please teach me the Dhamma as you have learned and memorized it.

mn125:4.6.pli: “Desetu me bhavaṁ aggivessano yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ.
mn125:4.6.en: “Master Aggivessana, please teach me the Dhamma as you have learned and memorized it.

mn125:5.1.pli: Atha kho aciravato samaṇuddeso jayasenassa rājakumārassa yathāsutaṁ yathāpariyattaṁ dhammaṁ desesi.
mn125:5.1.en: Then the novice Aciravata taught Prince Jayasena the Dhamma as he had learned and memorized it.

mn125:13.3.pli: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
mn125:13.3.en: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

thag4.10:1.1.en: “Dhamma surely protects one who practices Dhamma;

thag4.10:1.3.en: This is the benefit of practicing Dhamma:

thag4.10:2.1.en: It’s not the case that Dhamma and what is not Dhamma

thag4.10:2.3.en: What is not Dhamma leads to hell,

thag4.10:2.4.en: while Dhamma takes you to a good place.

sn55.53:1.2.pli: Atha kho dhammadinno upāsako pañcahi upāsakasatehi saddhiṁ yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho dhammadinno upāsako bhagavantaṁ etadavoca:
sn55.53:1.2.en: Then the lay follower Dhammadinna, together with five hundred lay followers, went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

sn55.53:2.1.en: “So, Dhammadinna, you should train like this:

sn55.53:3.1.en: “So, Dhammadinna, you should train like this:

sn35.74:9.1.pli: “Na khvāhaṁ, bhante, sīlavisuddhatthaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn35.74:9.1.en: “Because I understand that the Buddha has not taught the Dhamma merely for the sake of ethical purity.”

sn35.74:10.1.pli: “No ce kira tvaṁ, bhikkhu, sīlavisuddhatthaṁ mayā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāsi, atha kimatthaṁ carahi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, mayā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāsī”ti?
sn35.74:10.1.en: “If that is so, what exactly do you understand to be the purpose of teaching the Dhamma?”

sn35.74:11.1.pli: “Rāgavirāgatthaṁ khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn35.74:11.1.en: “I understand that the Buddha has taught the Dhamma for the purpose of the fading away of greed.”

sn35.74:12.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, bhikkhu, rāgavirāgatthaṁ mayā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāsi.
sn35.74:12.2.en: It’s good that you understand that I’ve taught the Dhamma for the purpose of the fading away of greed.

sn35.74:21.3.pli: Imasmiñca pana veyyākaraṇasmiṁ bhaññamāne tassa bhikkhuno virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
sn35.74:21.3.en: And while this discourse was being spoken, the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in that mendicant:

sn6.14:3.2.pli: ‘paṭibhātu, brāhmaṇa, taṁ brahmuno ca brahmaparisāya ca brahmapārisajjānañca dhammī kathā’ti.
sn6.14:3.2.en: ‘Brahmin, teach the Dhamma as you feel inspired for that Brahmā, his assembly, and the members of his retinue.’

sn6.14:3.3.pli: ‘Evaṁ, bhante’ti kho, bhikkhave, abhibhū bhikkhu sikhissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭissutvā, brahmānañca brahmaparisañca brahmapārisajje ca dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
sn6.14:3.3.en: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied Abhibhū. Then he educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

sn6.14:3.5.pli: ‘acchariyaṁ vata, bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, kathañhi nāma satthari sammukhībhūte sāvako dhammaṁ desessatī’ti.
sn6.14:3.5.en: ‘It’s incredible, it’s amazing! How on earth can a disciple teach Dhamma in the presence of the Teacher?’

sn6.14:4.3.pli: acchariyaṁ vata bho, abbhutaṁ vata bho, kathañhi nāma satthari sammukhībhūte sāvako dhammaṁ desessatīti.
sn6.14:4.3.en: that a disciple teaches Dhamma in the presence of the Teacher.

sn6.14:4.5.pli: ‘Evaṁ, bhante’ti kho, bhikkhave, abhibhū bhikkhu sikhissa bhagavato arahato sammāsambuddhassa paṭissutvā dissamānenapi kāyena dhammaṁ desesi, adissamānenapi kāyena dhammaṁ desesi, dissamānenapi heṭṭhimena upaḍḍhakāyena adissamānena uparimena upaḍḍhakāyena dhammaṁ desesi, dissamānenapi uparimena upaḍḍhakāyena adissamānena heṭṭhimena upaḍḍhakāyena dhammaṁ desesi.
sn6.14:4.5.en: ‘Yes, sir,’ replied Abhibhū. Then he taught Dhamma with his body visible; with his body invisible; with the lower half visible and the upper half invisible; and with the upper half visible and the lower half invisible.

an6.56:6.3.pli: Atha kho bhagavā āyasmantaṁ phaggunaṁ dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkāmi.
an6.56:6.3.en: Then the Buddha educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired Venerable Phagguṇa with a Dhamma talk, after which he got up from his seat and left.

an6.56:9.5.pli: Tassa tathāgato dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an6.56:9.5.en: The Realized One teaches them Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

an6.56:10.3.pli: Tassa tathāgatasāvako dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an6.56:10.3.en: The Realized One’s disciple teaches them Dhamma …

an6.56:12.3.pli: Tassa tathāgato dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ …pe… brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an6.56:12.3.en: The Realized One teaches them Dhamma …

an6.56:13.3.pli: Tassa tathāgatasāvako dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ …pe… parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
an6.56:13.3.en: The Realized One’s disciple teaches them Dhamma …

thag16.8:3.3.en: Now that I’ve heard your verse on Dhamma,

thag16.8:9.1.en: May even my enemies hear a Dhamma talk!

thag16.8:9.4.en: who establish others in the Dhamma!

thag16.8:10.1.en: May even my enemies hear Dhamma at the right time,

mn44:1.3.pli: Atha kho visākho upāsako yena dhammadinnā bhikkhunī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā dhammadinnaṁ bhikkhuniṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi. Ekamantaṁ nisinno kho visākho upāsako dhammadinnaṁ bhikkhuniṁ etadavoca:
mn44:1.3.en: Then the layman Visākha went to see the nun Dhammadinnā, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to her:

mn44:2.6.pli: “Sādhayye”ti kho visākho upāsako dhammadinnāya bhikkhuniyā bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā dhammadinnaṁ bhikkhuniṁ uttariṁ pañhaṁ apucchi:
mn44:2.6.en: Saying “Good, ma’am,” Visākha approved and agreed with what Dhammadinnā said. Then he asked another question:

mn44:30.1.pli: Atha kho visākho upāsako dhammadinnāya bhikkhuniyā bhāsitaṁ abhinanditvā anumoditvā uṭṭhāyāsanā dhammadinnaṁ bhikkhuniṁ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṁ katvā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṁ abhivādetvā ekamantaṁ nisīdi.
mn44:30.1.en: And then the layman Visākha approved and agreed with what the nun Dhammadinnā said. He got up from his seat, bowed, and respectfully circled her, keeping her on his right. Then he went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side,

mn44:30.4.pli: “paṇḍitā, visākha, dhammadinnā bhikkhunī, mahāpaññā, visākha, dhammadinnā bhikkhunī.
mn44:30.4.en: “The nun Dhammadinnā is astute, Visākha, she has great wisdom.

mn44:30.5.pli: Mañcepi tvaṁ, visākha, etamatthaṁ puccheyyāsi, ahampi taṁ evamevaṁ byākareyyaṁ, yathā taṁ dhammadinnāya bhikkhuniyā byākataṁ.
mn44:30.5.en: If you came to me and asked this question, I would answer it in exactly the same way as the nun Dhammadinnā.

an4.128:1.4.pli: sā tathāgatena anālaye dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṁ odahati aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:1.4.en: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of non-adherence, they want to listen, they lend an ear, and they apply their minds to understand it.

an4.128:2.2.pli: Sā tathāgatena mānavinaye dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṁ odahati aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:2.2.en: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of removing conceit, they want to listen, they lend an ear, and they apply their minds to understand it.

an4.128:3.2.pli: Sā tathāgatena opasamike dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṁ odahati aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:3.2.en: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of peace, they want to listen, they lend an ear, and they apply their minds to understand it.

an4.128:4.2.pli: Sā tathāgatena avijjāvinaye dhamme desiyamāne sussūsati sotaṁ odahati aññā cittaṁ upaṭṭhapeti.
an4.128:4.2.en: Yet when a Realized One is teaching the Dhamma of removing ignorance, they want to listen, they lend an ear, and they apply their minds to understand it.

an10.9:1.5.pli: parisāvacaro ca, no ca visārado parisāya dhammaṁ deseti …
an10.9:1.5.en: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance …

an10.9:1.12.pli: ‘kintāhaṁ saddho ca assaṁ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, vinayadharo ca, āraññiko ca pantasenāsano, ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te ca kāyena phusitvā vihareyyaṁ, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti.
an10.9:1.12.en: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’

an10.9:2.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseti, vinayadharo ca, āraññiko ca pantasenāsano, ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te ca kāyena phusitvā viharati, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an10.9:2.1.en: When they’re faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,

an8.72:2.4.pli: parisāvacaro ca, no ca visārado parisāya dhammaṁ deseti …pe…
an8.72:2.4.en: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance …

an8.72:2.9.pli: ‘kintāhaṁ saddho ca assaṁ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te kāyena phusitvā vihareyyaṁ, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti.
an8.72:2.9.en: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’

an8.72:3.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseti. Ye te santā vimokkhā atikkamma rūpe āruppā te ca kāyena phusitvā viharati, āsavānañca khayā …pe… sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an8.72:3.1.en: When they’re faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the formless liberations, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,

an10.8:2.4.pli: parisāvacaro ca, no ca visārado parisāya dhammaṁ deseti …
an10.8:2.4.en: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance …

an10.8:2.11.pli: ‘kintāhaṁ saddho ca assaṁ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, vinayadharo ca, āraññiko ca pantasenāsano, catunnañca jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī assaṁ akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti.
an10.8:2.11.en: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’

an10.8:3.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseti, vinayadharo ca, āraññiko ca pantasenāsano, catunnañca jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an10.8:3.1.en: When they’re faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who lives in the wilderness, in remote lodgings, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,

an8.71:3.1.pli: Saddho ca, bhikkhave, bhikkhu hoti sīlavā ca bahussuto ca, no ca dhammakathiko …pe…
an8.71:3.1.en: A mendicant is faithful, ethical, and learned, but not a Dhamma speaker. …

an8.71:3.3.pli: parisāvacaro ca, no ca visārado parisāya dhammaṁ deseti …pe…
an8.71:3.3.en: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance …

an8.71:3.8.pli: ‘kintāhaṁ saddho ca assaṁ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, catunnañca jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī assaṁ akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti.
an8.71:3.8.en: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’

an8.71:4.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseti, catunnañca jhānānaṁ ābhicetasikānaṁ diṭṭhadhammasukhavihārānaṁ nikāmalābhī hoti akicchalābhī akasiralābhī, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati;
an8.71:4.1.en: When they’re faithful, ethical, and learned, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, one who gets the four absorptions when they want, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,

an10.10:2.4.pli: no ca visārado parisāya dhammaṁ deseti visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseti,
an10.10:2.4.en: they don’t teach Dhamma to the assembly with assurance …

an10.10:2.11.pli: ‘kintāhaṁ saddho ca assaṁ, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseyyaṁ, vinayadharo ca, anekavihitañca pubbenivāsaṁ anussareyyaṁ, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussareyyaṁ, dibbena ca cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajāneyyaṁ, āsavānañca khayā …pe… sacchikatvā upasampajja vihareyyan’ti.
an10.10:2.11.en: ‘How can I become faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who recollects their many kinds of past lives, one who with clairvoyance that surpasses the human sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements?’

an10.10:3.1.pli: Yato ca kho, bhikkhave, bhikkhu saddho ca hoti, sīlavā ca, bahussuto ca, dhammakathiko ca, parisāvacaro ca, visārado ca parisāya dhammaṁ deseti, vinayadharo ca, anekavihitañca pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, seyyathidaṁ—ekampi jātiṁ dvepi jātiyo …pe… iti sākāraṁ sauddesaṁ anekavihitaṁ pubbenivāsaṁ anussarati, dibbena ca cakkhunā visuddhena atikkantamānusakena …pe… yathākammūpage satte pajānāti, āsavānañca khayā anāsavaṁ cetovimuttiṁ paññāvimuttiṁ diṭṭheva dhamme sayaṁ abhiññā sacchikatvā upasampajja viharati.
an10.10:3.1.en: When they are faithful, ethical, and educated, a Dhamma speaker, one who frequents assemblies, one who teaches Dhamma to the assembly with assurance, an expert in the training, one who recollects their many kinds of past lives, one who with clairvoyance that surpasses the human sees sentient beings passing away and being reborn, and one who lives having realized the ending of defilements,

an8.69:1.7.pli: Dhammiyā ca kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
an8.69:1.7.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

an8.69:1.10.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
an8.69:1.10.en: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

an8.69:2.10.pli: Dhammiyā ca kathāya sandassemi samādapemi samuttejemi sampahaṁsemi.
an8.69:2.10.en: I educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired them with a Dhamma talk.

an8.69:2.13.pli: Dhammiyā kathāya sandassetvā samādapetvā samuttejetvā sampahaṁsetvā antaradhāyāmi.
an8.69:2.13.en: And when my Dhamma talk was finished I vanished.

sn16.6:1.6.pli: ahaṁ vā bhikkhūnaṁ dhammiṁ kathaṁ kareyyaṁ tvaṁ vā”ti.
sn16.6:1.6.en: and give them a Dhamma talk.”

sn16.6:4.5.pli: “Kiṁ nu kho me tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānātha:
sn16.6:4.5.en: “Have you ever known me to teach the Dhamma like this:

sn16.6:4.9.pli: “No ce kira me tumhe, bhikkhave, evaṁ dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānātha, atha kiñcarahi tumhe, moghapurisā, kiṁ jānantā kiṁ passantā evaṁ svākkhāte dhammavinaye pabbajitā samānā aññamaññaṁ sutena accāvadatha:
sn16.6:4.9.en: “If you’ve never known me to teach the Dhamma like this, then what exactly do you know and see, you foolish men, that after going forth in such a well explained teaching and training you’d compete in studies to

sn21.3:2.4.pli: Api ca me ahosi dhammī kathā”ti.
sn21.3:2.4.en: But I have had some Dhamma talk.”

sn21.3:2.5.pli: “Kena saddhiṁ panāyasmato mahāmoggallānassa ahosi dhammī kathā”ti?
sn21.3:2.5.en: “Who did you have a Dhamma talk with?”

sn21.3:2.14.pli: “Yathākathaṁ panāyasmato mahāmoggallānassa bhagavatā saddhiṁ ahosi dhammī kathā”ti?
sn21.3:2.14.en: “But what manner of Dhamma talk did you have together?”

sn21.3:3.8.pli: Evaṁ kho me, āvuso, bhagavatā saddhiṁ ahosi dhammī kathā”ti.
sn21.3:3.8.en: That’s the Dhamma talk I had together with the Buddha.”

sn35.75:5.1.pli: “Na khvāhaṁ, bhante, sīlavisuddhatthaṁ bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn35.75:5.1.en: “Because I understand that the Buddha has not taught the Dhamma merely for the sake of ethical purity.”

sn35.75:6.1.pli: “No ce kira tvaṁ, bhikkhu, sīlavisuddhatthaṁ mayā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāsi, atha kimatthaṁ carahi tvaṁ, bhikkhu, mayā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāsī”ti?
sn35.75:6.1.en: “If that is so, what exactly do you understand to be the purpose of teaching the Dhamma?”

sn35.75:7.1.pli: “Anupādāparinibbānatthaṁ khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāmī”ti.
sn35.75:7.1.en: “I understand that the Buddha has taught the Dhamma for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.”

sn35.75:8.2.pli: Sādhu kho tvaṁ, bhikkhu, anupādāparinibbānatthaṁ mayā dhammaṁ desitaṁ ājānāsi.
sn35.75:8.2.en: It’s good that you understand that I’ve taught the Dhamma for the purpose of complete extinguishment by not grasping.

sn35.133:1.4.pli: Ekamantaṁ nisinnaṁ kho taṁ māṇavakaṁ āyasmā udāyī dhammiyā kathāya sandassesi samādapesi samuttejesi sampahaṁsesi.
sn35.133:1.4.en: Udāyī educated, encouraged, fired up, and inspired that student with a Dhamma talk.

sn35.133:1.7.pli: Samaṇo udāyī dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ, sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāsetī”ti.
sn35.133:1.7.en: The ascetic Udāyī teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.”

sn35.133:4.2.pli: Samaṇo panudāyī ‘bhaṇa, samaṇa, dhamman’ti vutto samāno ‘bhavissati, bhagini, samayo’ti vatvā uṭṭhāyāsanā pakkanto”ti.
sn35.133:4.2.en: But when I asked him to preach the Dhamma he just said that there would be an occasion for that, and then he got up and left.”

an8.21:4.7.pli: evamevaṁ kho me tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
an8.21:4.7.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in me:

an8.21:4.9.pli: So kho ahaṁ, bhante, diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane
an8.21:4.9.en: I saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. I went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions.

an8.21:8.1.pli: So ce, bhante, me āyasmā dhammaṁ deseti;
an8.21:8.1.en: If that venerable teaches me the Dhamma,

an8.21:8.3.pli: No ce me so āyasmā dhammaṁ deseti, ahamassa dhammaṁ desemi.
an8.21:8.3.en: But if they don’t teach me the Dhamma, I teach them.

an8.29:1.4.pli: Idha, bhikkhave, tathāgato ca loke uppanno hoti arahaṁ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṁ buddho bhagavā, dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito;
an8.29:1.4.en: Firstly, a Realized One has arisen in the world—perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those who wish to train, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed. He teaches the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One.

an8.29:8.2.pli: Dhammo ca na desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito. Ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitassa atthamaññātuṁ.
an8.29:8.2.en: So he doesn’t teach the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an8.29:10.4.pli: Dhammo ca desiyati opasamiko parinibbāniko sambodhagāmī sugatappavedito. Ayañca puggalo majjhimesu janapadesu paccājāto hoti, so ca hoti paññavā ajaḷo aneḷamūgo paṭibalo subhāsitadubbhāsitassa atthamaññātuṁ.
an8.29:10.4.en: He teaches the Dhamma leading to peace, extinguishment, awakening, as proclaimed by the Holy One. And a person is reborn in a central country. And they’re wise, bright, clever, and able to distinguish what is well said from what is poorly said.

an8.29:13.4.en: and the teaching of the Dhamma;

an8.22:4.8.pli: evamevaṁ kho me tasmiṁyeva āsane virajaṁ vītamalaṁ dhammacakkhuṁ udapādi:
an8.22:4.8.en: in that very seat the stainless, immaculate vision of the Dhamma arose in me:

an8.22:4.10.pli: So kho ahaṁ, bhante, diṭṭhadhammo pattadhammo viditadhammo pariyogāḷhadhammo tiṇṇavicikiccho vigatakathaṅkatho vesārajjappatto aparappaccayo satthusāsane tattheva buddhañca dhammañca saṅghañca saraṇaṁ agamāsiṁ, brahmacariyapañcamāni ca sikkhāpadāni samādiyiṁ.
an8.22:4.10.en: I saw, attained, understood, and fathomed the Dhamma. I went beyond doubt, got rid of indecision, and became self-assured and independent of others regarding the Teacher’s instructions. Right there I went for refuge to the Buddha, his teaching, and the Saṅgha. And I undertook the five training rules with celibacy as the fifth.

an8.22:7.3.pli: So ce me āyasmā dhammaṁ deseti;
an8.22:7.3.en: If that venerable teaches me the Dhamma,

an8.22:7.5.pli: No ce me so āyasmā dhammaṁ deseti, ahamassa dhammaṁ desemi.
an8.22:7.5.en: But if they don’t teach me the Dhamma, I teach them.

sn55.7:1.8.pli: So dhammaṁ deseti ādikalyāṇaṁ majjhekalyāṇaṁ pariyosānakalyāṇaṁ sātthaṁ sabyañjanaṁ, kevalaparipuṇṇaṁ parisuddhaṁ brahmacariyaṁ pakāseti.
sn55.7:1.8.en: He teaches Dhamma that’s good in the beginning, good in the middle, and good in the end, meaningful and well-phrased. And he reveals a spiritual practice that’s entirely full and pure.

sn55.7:2.4.pli: Tesaṁ no bhavaṁ gotamo amhākaṁ evaṅkāmānaṁ evaṁchandānaṁ evaṁadhippāyānaṁ tathā dhammaṁ desetu yathā mayaṁ puttasambādhasayanaṁ ajjhāvaseyyāma …pe… sugatiṁ saggaṁ lokaṁ upapajjeyyāmā”ti.
sn55.7:2.4.en: Given that we have such wishes, may the Buddha teach us the Dhamma so that we may achieve them.”

sn55.7:3.1.en: “Householders, I will teach you an explanation of the Dhamma that’s relevant to oneself.

sn55.7:4.1.en: “And what is the explanation of the Dhamma that’s relevant to oneself?

sn22.1:4.4.pli: Alattha no ajja bhagavato sammukhā dhammiṁ kathaṁ savanāyā”ti?
sn22.1:4.4.en: Did you get to hear a Dhamma talk in the Buddha’s presence today?”

sn22.1:5.2.pli: Idānāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto”ti.
sn22.1:5.2.en: Just now the Buddha anointed me with the deathless ambrosia of a Dhamma talk.”

sn22.1:5.3.pli: “Yathā kathaṁ pana tvaṁ, gahapati, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto”ti?
sn22.1:5.3.en: “But what kind of ambrosial Dhamma talk has the Buddha anointed you with?”

sn22.1:6.8.pli: Evaṁ khvāhaṁ, bhante, bhagavatā dhammiyā kathāya amatena abhisitto”ti.
sn22.1:6.8.en: “That’s the ambrosial Dhamma talk that the Buddha anointed me with.”

an4.191:2.6.pli: api ca kho bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṁ dhammaṁ deseti.
an4.191:2.6.en: However, a mendicant with psychic powers, who has achieved mastery of the mind, teaches Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:3.5.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṁ dhammaṁ deseti;
an4.191:3.5.en: But passages of the teaching don’t come back to them when they’re happy, nor does a mendicant with psychic powers … teach Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:3.6.pli: api ca kho devaputto devaparisāyaṁ dhammaṁ deseti.
an4.191:3.6.en: However, a god teaches Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

an4.191:4.5.pli: Tassa tattha na heva kho sukhino dhammapadā plavanti, napi bhikkhu iddhimā cetovasippatto devaparisāyaṁ dhammaṁ deseti, napi devaputto devaparisāyaṁ dhammaṁ deseti;
an4.191:4.5.en: But passages of the teaching don’t come back to them when they’re happy, and neither a mendicant with psychic powers … nor a god teaches Dhamma to the assembly of gods.

sn22.90:1.3.pli: “ovadantu maṁ āyasmanto therā, anusāsantu maṁ āyasmanto therā, karontu me āyasmanto therā dhammiṁ kathaṁ, yathāhaṁ dhammaṁ passeyyan”ti.
sn22.90:1.3.en: “May the venerable senior mendicants advise me and instruct me! May they give me a Dhamma talk so that I can see the teaching!”

sn22.90:3.17.pli: Ko nu kho me tathā dhammaṁ deseyya yathāhaṁ dhammaṁ passeyyan”ti.
sn22.90:3.17.en: Who can teach me the Dhamma so that I can see the teaching?”

sn22.90:4.2.pli: “ayaṁ kho āyasmā ānando kosambiyaṁ viharati ghositārāme satthu ceva saṁvaṇṇito sambhāvito ca viññūnaṁ sabrahmacārīnaṁ, pahoti ca me āyasmā ānando tathā dhammaṁ desetuṁ yathāhaṁ dhammaṁ passeyyaṁ;
sn22.90:4.2.en: “The Venerable Ānanda is staying near Kosambi, in Ghosita’s Monastery. He’s praised by the Buddha and esteemed by his sensible spiritual companions. He’s quite capable of teaching me the Dhamma so that I can see the teaching.

sn22.90:7.5.en: “May Venerable Ānanda advise me and instruct me! May he give me a Dhamma talk so that I can see the teaching!”
